questions.question: Which one of the following sentences is correct?
Which of the following tenses are used to talk about recent actions that have present results?
answers: present perfect and present perfect continuous

questions.question: Which one of the following tenses is used to talk about general truths?
Which one of the following tenses is used to talk about actions and events that are going on at around the time of talking?
Which one of the following tenses are used to talk about actions and situations that started in the past and have continued up to the present?
Which of the following sentences are grammatically correct?
answers: I will have finished this job by next week.
I have finished this job by next week.
I have been finishing this job by next week.
